sen.e: Although Japan was in the position involving in Korean finance and diplomacy due to the conclusion of the First Japan-Korea Treaty of 1904 when the Russo-Japanese War was under way, she decided to conclude this treaty in order to seek the Korean Empire, who had lost trust from Japan, to take more reliable actions, because Japan had been approved of the priority rights to Korea by Russia due to the Treaty of Portsmouth (September 5, 1905), the peace treaty of the Russo-Japanese War, and also because it became a problem that Gao Zong (King of Korea) had sent a secret agent to other countries to show his discontent with the First Japan-Korea Treaty.
